node.text:
They are a lesser known order of the Putus Templar. Particularly reviling those of a psychic persuasion, they are an order that take on aspects of that which they most revile to better fight it. They are repeatedly subjected to the gaze of a creature known as a Gamma Moth, which often leaves them with genetic defects, but occasionally allows for useful powers to manifest.
What's worse is that the man hunting our woodsprog friend is no mere press-ganged recruit, but a true believer, from a noble family that was able to fund injectors that significantly reduced his risk, meaning he lacks any of the weaknesses of his allies. And there is nothing more dangerous than an evil man, convinced that what he does is right.

node.text: They rarely travel in groups more than three or four. They bear a pair of flaming swords, that can carve both your flesh or your mind, and wield large, powerful pistols. They also often bear special injectors, that instil incredible focus and make them immune to psychic attacks. The moths that are used to create them have been bred over the years to prefer pyroclastic effects, meaning that while their mutations are random, it is extremely common that they can cast powerful rays of flame.

node.text: Is a long tale. Terrible pain, but I shall share it. I was once shaman to a Minyan, our community. I had a vision, as a young sprog. Drew me to an old place. There we found the base for the Godhed. For many years, we accompanied it, teaching it our ways. So that we might bestow it our mask. I know not how the hunter heard of me. Maybe he had not. But as we fled the Sowers' eye, the hunter fell upon us both. He burned the Sower shaman, and turned on us. He wrecked the holy godhed. Slaughtered the Minyan. Burned the Sowers. Only I escaped, and he followed me for many days. As I fled, the trees thinned and were replaced by the great eastern water. Still he came for me. I crossed the water, and he did follow. Then into the great coral I fled, before collapsing at the gates of this place. Saw me come here, I do not know why he has not tried to take me. But he will. He always follows.
node.choice: Regardless, they sound like a dangerous foe. How did you come to earn their ire?
I am sorry to hear how you have suffered. The Templar are no friends of mine, do you know where this hunter might be now? I would gladly free you from his predation.
I am sorry that you suffered so. Live and drink, Qolohish.
